timeline.bodyText:
Not sure if this old segment check is necessary:

since the old segment will be replaced, it shall be safe to update the valid doc, since it will be gone anyway?
if so, then the handling is identical to the branch above, and therefore can be merged?
timeline.author: yupeng9

replies.bodyText: When we commit a consuming segment, or reload a completed segment, the data will be identical (could be re-ordered). If we update the valid doc, before we replace the old segment in the data manager, all the docs in the old segment will be invalidated. Even though it can recover after the segment is replaced, we will observe data loss before that.
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: ah I see. So the window could be until the segment seal. Makes sense.
replies.author: yupeng9

timeline.bodyText: nit: I think it's preferred to enable it as early as possible (i.e in the constructor), we know this segment will be an upsert one.
timeline.author: yupeng9

replies.bodyText:
I moved this method out of the constructor because the segment loader doesn't need to know whether the segment has upsert enabled or not, and upsert metadata is updated after the segment is loaded.
Decoupling upsert from the segment loader help simplify the code path for the loading part, and keep all the upsert handling at the same place: RealtimeTableDataManager.addSegment(ImmutableSegment immutableSegment)
